help.title: Frequently Asked Questions
help.q1: How do I clock in correctly?
help.a1: You need to clock in during your assigned shift using the 'Clock In' button or use the biometric attendance machine at the office.
help.q2: What should I do if I forget to clock in?
help.a2: Submit an attendance adjustment request or inform your direct manager for confirmation.
help.q3: How can I contact technical support?
help.a3: Send an email to the IT department or call the internal hotline 1234 during working hours.
help.q4: Can incorrect attendance records be corrected?
help.a4: Yes. You can submit a correction request with a reason, and your manager will review it.
help.a5: Overtime is valid only when pre-approved by the manager and when you clock out after regular working hours.
help.q6: When is salary calculated and paid?
help.a6: Salary is calculated from the 21st to the 20th of each month and paid on the 25th.
help.q7: Where can I check the details if my salary is lower than expected?
help.a7: You can view deduction details in the 'Payroll' section. If something seems incorrect, contact the HR department.
help.q8: When do employees become eligible for official employment?
help.a8: The probation period is 2 months. After meeting the requirements, the official contract will be issued within 5 days.
help.q9: When will my employment contract be renewed?
help.a9: Thirty days before the contract expires, the system sends a reminder and HR will contact you for renewal.
help.q10: When does the company start paying insurance for employees?
help.a10: The company pays social, health, and unemployment insurance from the month following the official contract date.
help.a11: Employees receive 12 days of annual leave per year plus one extra day for each year of seniority.
help.q12: How do I register for a training course?
help.a12: You can register in the 'Training' section. Mandatory courses will automatically be assigned to you.
help.q13: How can I update my personal information?
help.a13: Go to the 'Personal Profile' section, update the information, and submit for HR approval if required.
